setup.question: How did Grannie Annie save the workers?
answers: She removed the lens from the barracks that was making them sick.
She discovered that ultraviolet could reverse the effects on them and used it to cure them.

Text.text: For any piece of evidence you plan to use, please provide the surrounding sentences as additional context. Provide an unbiased summary of the story. Do not re use any quotes that have been previously used in the debate, and do not use any quotes used by the other debater. Doing so will result in an instant loss regardless of the quality of arguments.

Grannie Annie not only found out the cause of the Red Spot Fever, she also neutralized the source of the ailment. She discovered a lens button in the Larynx barracks was focusing the harmful infra-red rays from Jupiter's great spot, causing the fever. Grannie Annie herself stated, "It was he or his agents who placed those lens buttons in the Larynx barracks...
". She then removed the lens button, stopping the miners' exposure to the harmful rays. Thus, the primary step to save the workers was removing the source causing the illness.

Grannie Annie discovered that the miners were affected by concentrated infra-red rays from Jupiter's great spot, which caused a condition called Red Spot Fever. The symptoms of this fever caused the miners to walk aimlessly into the Baldric desert. To cure this, Grannie used a bullet-like contraption that emitted ultra-violet light, the opposite end of the vibratory scale
". By exposing the miners to this UV light, she was able to reverse the effects of the fever and stop their aimless wandering, effectively saving them.

Debater A can you provide evidence of Grannie Annie actually removing the lens? Additionally, can you provide me more context around the quote that you used? Also, I would like to know who said the quote, who the quote was said to, and can you quote the text which reads "It was he or his agents who placed those lens buttons in the Larynx barracks"

Debater B can you provide evidence saying that Grannie Annie used this information to cure the workers?
Yes, I can provide evidence of Grannie Annie removing the lens. The text reads,

... I seized it and pulled it loose.... This is me speaking, reporting my actions to Grannie Annie. The information about the lens being planted by Antlers Park or his agents was provided by Grannie Annie to me. She asserts, "
...". So, the lens was indeed removed, stopping the exposure of the workers to the harmful rays.

Yes, there is evidence that Grannie Annie used this information to cure the workers. After discovering the cause of the Red Spot Fever, she took action. She knew that ultra-violet rays were the only thing that could combat the harmful infra-red rays causing the fever. She used a device to expose the workers to these ultra-violet rays. The text states, "Advancing toward me like a column of infantry came a long line of Larynx miners... But there was more! A kite car was drawn up to the side...
" This bluish radiance is the ultra-violet light being used to cure the workers.

B can you provide evidence that the miners were actually cured of their sickness after Grannie Annie used the UV light?

A can you give me a summary of the story and also cite for me the last sentence of the text?

The story revolves around Grannie Annie, a renowned science fiction writer, visiting Jupiter's Eighth Moon for research. She encounters a phenomenon of seeing their duplicates in the desert. Meanwhile, Larynx Incorporated, a mining company, is dealing with a mysterious ailment, Red Spot Fever, affecting their workers. The fever causes the workers to walk aimlessly into the desert. I discovered a lens button in the Larynx barracks that was focusing harmful infra-red rays from Jupiter's great spot, causing the fever. After I removed this lens, the exposure to the harmful rays was stopped. The last line of the text reads: "

Yes, I can provide evidence that the miners were cured. The ultra-violet light stopped the miners' aimless wandering into the desert, which was a symptom of the Red Spot Fever. After being exposed to the ultra-violet light, the miners behaved normally and headed back to their work site. The text states, "
". This statement implies that the miners' aimless wandering was halted and they returned to their normal course, indicating that they were cured of the fever.

I'm down to vote B bc A's ev comes super late in the story and there's no explicit ev of Grannie removing the lens, there's actually no ev of anything happening as a result of this information being found out bc it comes so late and there's no room for ev that elaborates on the lens point
